basics.name: Devin Eng
basics.label: Graduate Student
basics.summary: Hello! I am currently obtaining my M.S. in Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of Hawaii and concurrently working to gain more computer science experience. I expect to graduate in December, 2022.

work.company: University of Hawaii Manoa Zhang Lab
work.summary: Supporting the front-end software development of a Hawaii Department of Transportation sponsored research project on information exchanges between vehicles to effectively balance traffic demand distribution among traffic networks and facilitate flow progression

work.company: University of Washington, Division of Dermatology
work.summary: Developed CRISPR technology for targeted epigenome editing (DNA demethylation) to reverse cancer phenotypes in skin cancer cells. Generated Python code to analyze large-scale caffeine consumption data (9,000+ individuals); presented findings at the 2020 UW Undergraduate Research Symposium. Co-authored publications and reviewed grant and scientific paper drafts

awards.title: Levinson Emerging Scholars Award
awards.summary: Awarded for research that furthers innovation in bioscience and related fields

awards.title: Mary Gates Research Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded for my motivation, understanding of research, and impact of research project

awards.title: Purple and Gold Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded for excellence in high school academics, athletics, and extracurriculars

awards.title: Kaimana Award
awards.summary: Awarded for excellence in high school academics, sportsmanship, and extracurriculars

awards.title: Hawaii Rotary Youth Foundation Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded for excellence in high school academics, athletics, and extracurriculars

volunteer.company: University of Washington, Undergraduate Research Program
volunteer.summary: Presented at classes and panels research opportunities and resources to encourage new undergraduate researchers

volunteer.company: American Association for the Advancement of Science
volunteer.summary: Assisted presenters with setting up and counted audience members
Scorekeeping, prepared kendo practicioners for matches, and distributed food

volunteer.company: Hui Hoaloha 'Ulana (University of Washington Hawaii Club)

volunteer.summary: Assisted teak deck replacement, turret restoration, carpentry projects, construction of new exhibits, painting, and event preparation. Supervised groups as large as 30 for restoration projects and provided ship tourss
